intro: Iridorkis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty iridorkis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related genera. The plant is characterized by its striking, metallic-green leaves and showy, yellow-and-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its unique coloration and habitat preferences make it a notable species in its native environment. Iridorkis ferruginea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
